title: 107_s550
content: The Act titled "Indian and Alaska Native Foster Care and Adoption Services Amendments of 2001" allows Indian tribes to receive federal funds for foster care and adoption assistance. The Act allows Indian tribes to receive federal funds for foster care and adoption assistance, including children placed in tribal custody being eligible for funding. Indian tribes or intertribal consortiums can receive funds if they have a cooperative agreement with a State or submit arrangements for child welfare services. "SEC. 479B. PROGRAMS OPERATED BY INDIAN TRIBAL ORGANIZATIONS." This part applies to Indian tribes operating programs similar to states, with modifications to plan requirements such as identifying service areas and approving foster homes based on tribal standards for child safety. Federal share determination is based on per capita income. The federal share determination for Indian tribes is based on per capita income, with the calculation taking into account the service population and allowing tribes to submit relevant information for consideration. The Secretary determines the per capita income of Indian tribes based on relevant information provided by the tribes. The Secretary also regulates the proportions to be paid to tribes, ensuring they receive no less than the amount specified for a State. Tribes can use Federal or State funds to match payments they are eligible for. The Secretary may modify requirements if it benefits the tribes after consultation. The Secretary may modify requirements under this part at the request of Indian tribes to benefit the safety of children. Intertribal consortiums can submit a single plan under section 471. Indian tribes and States can enter into cooperative agreements for fund administration. Existing cooperative agreements remain valid and enforceable. The Secretary can modify requirements under this part for child safety at the request of Indian tribes. Intertribal consortiums can submit a single plan under section 471. Indian tribes and States can enter into cooperative agreements for fund administration, which remain valid and enforceable. Regulations will be promulgated within a year to carry out this section. The amendments take effect upon enactment of the Act.
